name: Te Anau Lakeview Holiday Park

reviews.text: Stayed in a dorm then a single room. Perfectly adequate, and very clean! Fresh bath mats and clean showers each morning. Win. Some of, but not all of, the campsites are quite close to the road, you may want to ask in advance to ensure if you're camping you're in a quiet spot.
reviews.title: Clean. Tidy. Cheap. Lovely.

reviews.text: Great place to stay before embarking on a lovely journey up to Milford Sound. The place had a lot of parking with kids playground and good staff to handle inquiries. The place provided good laundry and kitchen utensils.
reviews.title: Awesome holiday park.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had two super relaxed nights at the apartment.
reviews.title: Great stay: Excellent rooms, a little bit pricy though!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect start point for Doubtful Sound.
reviews.title: A delightful holiday park, ideal for camper vans

reviews.text: A little pricy though, for the newly furnished appartments, which really have great views on the lake and the mountains.
reviews.title: Geat veiws of lake and mountains

reviews.text: Stayed in a Marakura Family Unit for 3 nights. Very new and modern apartment with excellent facilities. Quite expensive for the location. Amazing views over the lake and mountains. 20 minutes walk along the lake front into the centre of town.
reviews.title: Luxury apartments with great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have time, I recommend the 15 minute stroll to the Te Anau Wildlife Centre for a view of some native wildlife.
reviews.title: Handy Location with Lake Views, Good Value but Bathrooms Dated

reviews.text: We stayed just 1 night in one of the tourist flats - it had excellent views across the road over the lake. The Holiday Park caters for a range of budgets & needs. It's a good 15-20 minutes walk into town, but otherwise is handily located; it's only 5 minutes away from a great DOC information centre and is located alongside Tracknet.The room was spacious and although it had recently been painted, was somewhat dated (mostly the bathroom). The bathroom was also a little small and the shower head low for tall people. Also no facecloth was provided.
reviews.title: Excellent value for quality accommodation - and a view to die for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our group of 12 stayed her overnight prior to walking the Milford Track and I have nothing but praise for everyone we dealt with and we were all very impressed with our accommodation.
reviews.title: Great value for money.
Bad service and over priced
reviews.text: We stayed in three sets of double rooms in their Koromiko wing for a reasonable rate of $69 per double. Two couples shared a bathroom, but had their own hotel suite with a comfortable double bed, mini fridge, kettle, crockery and cutlery. An absolute bargain for the price.

We stayed in a private room (the motel part of the place) and it was big, nice and convenient. The wifi worked just fine for our 2 laptops and 2 mobiles. The lake view from our window was just great. Obviously it's not a fancy place, but in comparison to other motels in New Zealand it's just fine.
reviews.title: Nice value for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Te Anau Lakeview Holiday Park on 30 September 2012. The site is big and we were lucky enough to get a powered spot with a great view of the lake for $34. We'd picked the site from our guide book because of the sauna and spa facilities after a lengthy drive from The Catlins and a recently obtained broken shoulder (!) - so we were really disappointed when we arrived to be told these facilities were out of order! However, this was in no way the fault of the site and due to some guests misusing the facilities so it couldn't be helped and the park itself was a lovely spot. We enjoyed an evening stroll around the lake to the small nearby wildlife park - highly recommended.
reviews.title: Beautiful site with fantastic views
Nice Holiday Park
reviews.text: I've stayed at this place 3 separate trips, for a total of more than 10 nights (I lost track of the exact amount). It's a holiday park - I think some of the other reviewers forgot that. It's not some sort of 5 star hotel, but it would be hard to find a better holiday park than this one. I feel absolutely comfortable staying there and plan to many more times in the future.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ONLY reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because you have to pay for internet, and even then, it's only available in the very center of the facility. There are $15/night hostels in the area that have unlimited wifi, so I think that should be pretty standard at these places.
reviews.title: Nice Camping Ground

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that, I would recommend this place to anyone. The staff was quite friendly, except for the lady who somewhat rudely refused my request to check out an hour late.
reviews.title: Breathtaking views and very clean - all holiday parks should be like this

reviews.text: The location was beautiful, looking out across the lake. The facilities were very good as well and very clean. One thing I really liked about this holiday park compared to some others is that the powered sites are spread away from each other nicely. We actually had room to move which was cool. I also paid to use the internet and I got 30 free days of internet for just $5! Now of course, we were not there for 30 days but I thought it was incredibly cheep!
reviews.title: Great place to stay.

reviews.text: Another thing I liked about it was that the beautiful lake and natural walkways were just across the road. And just a 15 minute walk away from the park into the bush and you come to the Te Anau Wildlife Park, a little park set up by DOC where rescued native birds are kept and visitors can see them up close for free.
reviews.title: Good to be back....24 years later!

reviews.text: I stayed here as a 20 year old with my parents and sister and really enjoyed it. Nearly a quarter of a century later I returned with my hubby and 2 kids, which was very special for me. My memory was foggy, but thankfully the view wasn't. Our main room had an uninterrupted view overlooking beautiful lake Te Anau with stunning snow-capped mountains in the background.
reviews.title: Great for a holiday park

reviews.text: This is pretty much a caravan park, so don't expect too much. Our holiday cabin (tourist flat) was adequate and we appreciated the 2 bedrooms. I was on very strong painkillers at the time for a sore back, so preferred to sleep on the spare single bed instead of rolling towards the middle of the queen bed.
reviews.title: Nice for the price, but quirky.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The holiday park is next to the TrackNet transport office which is very convenient if you don't have a car.
reviews.title: good base for milford and doubtful sounds

aka: Te Anau Lakeview Holiday Park Hotel Te Anau
description: Large property with a wide range of accommodation. Opposite Lake Te Anau with stunning views of Lakes and Mountains
